title: Mafia / Queenpin LeBlanc
body:
> Owner, proprietress and singer at the ritzy Noxian nightclub “The Black Rose,” LeBlanc’s taste for glamour and intrigue made her a natural fit for the higher end of organized crime. Rarely dirtying her own hands, LeBlanc’s operation serves as a front for the syndicate she deftly and ruthlessly puppeteers, as well as a headquarters where the mafiosa matriarch is guaranteed a private audience with both guests and victims alike. 

Hey everyone! I wanted to share a concept I made for a new LeBlanc skin! I think LeBlanc's established character fantasy of political intrigue and assassination lends itself perfectly to an alternate fantasy as the head of LoL's organized crime syndicate.

https://40.media.tumblr.com/0fa0bfde60074b9ecbd03194ef4b3724/tumblr_o0jw6za3rq1qk32lpo3_1280.png

This skin was inspired by the mystery woman in the Knockout Lee Sin splash art!

http://i.imgur.com/I6T7oTc.png

The idea sprang from reimagining "The Black Rose" as a speakeasy lounge, and sort of evolved from there. 

https://36.media.tumblr.com/875e632bf9ba063a8c00b7b17581c5f2/tumblr_o0jw6za3rq1qk32lpo5_540.png

In my mind the skin will be along the lines of Star Guardian Lux, featuring new sound effects, VO, and maybe some fresh animations! I'd like for her recall (or maybe even a dance replacement like Mafia Jinx's) to feature her humming a jazzy rendition of a song from the LoL Soundtrack, randomly selected from a repertoire of about 3 or 4! I'd like to get to work on a splash art soon featuring the entire Mafia skin line, drinking and conducting business inside the Black Rose. Kingpin Twitch isn't allowed inside C:

Here are a few in game model mockups

https://40.media.tumblr.com/be042ce330c7b0ae73de373825c8b185/tumblr_o0jw6za3rq1qk32lpo1_1280.png

Here's a color edit of what her clone might look like!

https://40.media.tumblr.com/0b1add9ab4b5ec8515f0aec875946751/tumblr_o0jw6za3rq1qk32lpo2_1280.png

And another quick paintover I did for fun when I realized how long her hair must be to have it done up so big! ~~it's full of secrets~~

https://41.media.tumblr.com/daf50cb70a2ce58ee1d02ab8c946a02e/tumblr_o0jw6za3rq1qk32lpo4_1280.png

In my mind I also imagine Ariana Savalas as her singing voice!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yQGFeRI0qbg

Hope you guys like it, let me know what you think! I had a lot of fun making it!

Geometric fashion hit its stride in the 1960s. This is a sort of hybrid between retro geometric and modern sculptural. So it definitely is modern with a retro influence.

That said, it's *also* era-accurate for the 1920s because of the form and art deco influence on shape. However, the look would have been achieved through ruching, not geometric paneling. 

I dare anyone at Rito to design a dress with visible ruching with the current art style/self-imposed graphical limitations. Until then, this LeBlanc is flawless.

I actually did some experimenting with ruching instead of the paneling when I first started drafting the concept! Eventually I decided to prioritize readability to historical accuracy and add some shape and style to the gown without overloading it with visual information. I love this fashion analysis, thanks so much for taking the time to check the concept out!
It is sooooo beautiful and such a fully realized concept this is incredible!

OP, this is flawless. My only criticisms are a matter of taste:

- The hat looks like a stewardess
- The Beehive didn't come into fashion until the late 1950s
- 20s makeup trends were for dark or bright red lips
- Bleached platinum blonde finger wave is an iconic 20s hairstyle

Ahh i forgot to mention in the original post that the skin was inspired by this woman in the Knockout Lee Sin Splash out of my sheer desperation that it was a teaser for an upcoming skin, so the hat and hairstyle were pretty much set in stone already. I'd love to drum up some alternate hairstyle and hat paintovers!
http://i.imgur.com/I6T7oTc.png

Maybe more of a [calot](https://royalhats.wordpress.com/2013/10/29/hat-types-the-calot/) than a stewardess style hat?  The angle from the Knockout Lee Sin splash is a little ambigious, and calots were super popular in the 1920s.  Please ignore the suggestion if it's not your thing :)

Thanks so much for the suggestion! I was going for a Pillbox style but in the shape of the hat in the splash but there's definitely room for interpretation! That'd definitely suit the era better, I'll give it a try!
